questions.question_text: Scenario: Alex is a member of the HR Tier 1 group which grants him the HR Basic [sn_hr_core.basic] role. He is going to be out of the office for a few days and wants to use granular delegation to allow his friend Amy to complete his tasks. Amy is not yet a member of any HR groups, but hopes to transfer into HR one day. Will granular delegation work for this purpose?

choices.C: Partially. Granular delegation will allow Amy access to the HR Tasks, but not to the HR Case itself.
choices.D: No. Granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records.
choices.B: Yes. Granular delegation will automatically add Amy to the HR Tier 1 group where she will inherit the role.
choices.A: Yes. Granular delegation will automatically grant the necessary roles

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
100% D

Servicenow Docs:

Important: Granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records. To access records, a delegate must already have the necessary roles. For example, to delegate task records, a delegate must have a role such as itil to access the Task table and its extensions.

Selected Answer: D
Ebook claims that delegation does not change roles assignment, so D.

Selected Answer: D
D is quoted from the e-book.
D is correct
Answer is D. Page 152 of Implementation ebook (Tokyo) - "granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records"

Granular delegation provides the ability to delegate specific records by table and condition. It also allows admins to delegate approvals and/or task assignments for task tables they administer."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-employee-service-management/page/product/employee-service-management/granular-delegation/concept/granular-delegation.html
